intro: Camassia quamash subsp. typica, commonly known as the western camas, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in meadows and woodland areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces bulbous roots that are used by indigenous peoples for food. This species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
